headings: Transcripts from baccalaureate degree awarding university or college
paragraphs: Advance your career and expand your opportunities in the healthcare industry.
Upload unofficial transcripts, with the exception of Angelo State University transcripts, for application evaluation purposes using theGraduate Studies Documents for Submissionform.
Please do not send official transcript(s) until you have received a notice of acceptance from Angelo State University. Unless an unofficial transcript is not on hand, please request one.
Official university transcripts should be sent through a secure electronic method (examples: Credential Solutions, Parchment, etc.) tograduate.studies@angelo.eduor by mail to:
Please submit the resume using theGraduate Studies Documents for Submissionform.
Applicants may submit unofficial test scores using theGraduate Studies Documents for Submissionform.
Note:Official scores will be required, if admitted.
The Norris-Vincent College of Business will evaluate applicants individually who do not meet the overall/cumulative GPA of 3.20 or better. The evaluation will include:
Applicants may be required to take leveling courses or modules.
Students are welcome to apply for admission regardless of their undergraduate major.
This graduate-level certificate program consists of 12 credit hours. That means you only have to complete four courses to earn your certificate.
You can earn your certificate in as few as two semesters, depending on course availability and how many courses you take each semester.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

The certificate is part of the
Expand your knowledge about issues regarding ethics, healthcare finance, healthcare operations and healthcare communications.
Learn from highly-qualified faculty with expertise and significant experience in both healthcare and business.
Add an excellent credential to your résumé as you prepare to advance to management and leadership roles in the healthcare industry.
Apply Texasapplication.If you have problems accessing the application, please contact the College of Graduate Studies and Research at 325-942-2169 orgraduate.studies@angelo.edu.

Unless an unofficial transcript is not on hand, please request one.Official university transcripts should be sent through a secure electronic method (examples: Credential Solutions, Parchment, etc.) tograduate.studies@angelo.eduor by mail to:College of Graduate Studies and ResearchASU Station #11025San Angelo, Texas 76909-1025
Must hold a bachelor’s degree in business from an accredited college or university.
GMAT (score a 500 or higher on the GMAT or an equivalent on the GRE)
Spring B:Applications will open on Jan 22
Fall B:Applications will open on Aug 30
MGMT 6340: Healthcare Communications in a Diverse Workplace
MGMT 6343: Legal and Ethical Aspects of Healthcare
